column3: Increased funding for the National Binge Drinking Strategy.

column2: Reducing the negative consequences of drinking and alcohol intoxication
column3: Created a programmme supporting young people affected by underage drinking who have been intercepted by police. The aim is to offer appropriate assistance through partnerships between the police and health services. This diversionary measure is aimed to facilitate youth to get "back on track" before more serious alcohol-related problems emerge.
Commenced surveillance of behavioral risk factors.
Alcohol Dependence Treatment Programme formulated by the Correctional Bureau for prisoners with alcohol problems.
Programme developed by the Correctional Bureau for drunk drivers and has begun to implement it in penal institutions since September 2010.
Created a Healthy Lifestyle Campaign including 'live healthy without alcohol'.
Issued a training module on awareness for alcohol-related harms for healthcare workers.

Report issued by the Law Commission entitled 'Alcohol in our lives: Curbing the harm "A report of the review of the regulatory framework for the sale and supply of liquor"'. Released the findings of the 2007/08 New Zealand Alcohol and Drug Use Survey.
Increased flexibility for travellers purchasing duty free alcohol.
Drafted the National Alcohol Strategy and Action Plan.
Enforced better restrictive control of driving under the influence of alcohol.
Enforced better restrictive control of availability of alcohol.
